description.raw:
* Ensure any bytestrings read from file attributes are turned into
  unicode strings. This resolves an issue raised [on the mailing list](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/labscriptsuite/UVwPzn8WcRk/Kj9rLOuOBgAJ). Labscript suite programs only write vlen strings to these attributes, which are read in as native strings (bytes on py2, unicode on py3), but it's good to ensure they're all read as unicode strings no matter how they were written.

* Remove pandas monkeypatch that has been included in pandas since
  version 0.21, which we now depend on.

* Remove an unused line of code.

* Remove reading of attributes that only pertained to mise
description.html:
• Ensure any bytestrings read from file attributes are turned into unicode strings. This resolves an issue raised on the mailing list. Labscript suite programs only write vlen strings to these attributes, which are read in as native strings (bytes on py2, unicode on py3), but it's good to ensure they're all read as unicode strings no matter how they were written.

  • Remove pandas monkeypatch that has been included in pandas since version 0.21, which we now depend on.

  • Remove an unused line of code.

  • Remove reading of attributes that only pertained to mise

summary.html:
• Ensure any bytestrings read from file attributes are turned into unicode strings. This resolves an issue raised on the mailing list. Labscript suite programs only write vlen strings to these attributes, which are read in as native strings (bytes on py2, unicode on py3), but it's good to ensure they're all read as unicode strings no matter how they were written.

  • Remove pandas monkeypatch that has been included in pandas since version 0.21, which we now depend on.

  • Remove an unused line of code.

  • Remove reading of attributes that only pertained to mise
